articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
Introduction
Writing large data sets to a file can become a challenge when you're dealing with iterators in Rust, specifically when the base type is u8. You might wonder about the best practices for writing these iterators efficiently without collecting them into a large vector first. Let‚Äôs explore the problem and discover an effective approach.
Understanding the Problem
When you have an iterator with a large length in Rust, collecting it into a vector can lead to high memory consumption and inefficiency. Ideally, you want to write data to a file directly from the iterator stream. This minimizes memory usage and allows for processed data to be written efficiently in chunks.
Efficiently Writing to a File with BufWriter
Using a BufWriter can help buffer the output to a file, which generally ‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Efficiently Write a Large Iterator to a File in Rust?

articles.author: Alex Aslam
articles.description:
Hey fellow developer! üëã Let‚Äôs talk about the real journey of building browser extensions:

You spend hours crafting the perfect feature, hit "Load Unpacked," and‚Ä¶ nothing happens. Or worse‚Äîyour extension works on your machine but turns into a pumpkin üéÉ on your friend‚Äôs browser.  
Debugging extensions can feel like wrestling gremlins, but don‚Äôt panic! I‚Äôve been there (and lived to tell the tale). Let‚Äôs break down the most common errors and their fixes so you can get back to shipping magic.  
1. ‚ÄúMy Extension Doesn‚Äôt Load!‚Äù (Manifest File Mayhem)


The Error: Chrome/Firefox ignores your extension, or you get a cryptic ‚ÄúInvalid manifest‚Äù warning.  
Why It Happens:  
Manifest Version Mismatch: Using V2 syntax in a V3 world (or vice versa).


Missing Fields: Forgot action, permissions, or hos‚Ä¶
articles.title: Debugging Browser Extensions: Taming the Chaos Like a Pro üõ†Ô∏è

articles.author: Alex Aslam
articles.description:
Hey fellow devs! üëã Let‚Äôs talk about browser extensions. You know, those little tools that make the web better‚Äîblocking ads, enhancing productivity, or even replacing Twitter‚Äôs bird logo with a dancing taco üåÆ. But if you‚Äôve ever built one with vanilla JavaScript, you‚Äôve probably faced:  
Spaghetti UI code that‚Äôs impossible to maintain.


State management nightmares across popups, options pages, and content scripts.


Rebuilding wheels for every minor feature.



What if I told you modern frameworks like React, Vue, or Svelte can turn extension development from a chore into a joyride? Let‚Äôs dive in.  
Why Use React/Vue/Svelte for Extensions?




Component Magic: Break your UI into reusable pieces (popups, modals, settings).


State Management: Share data between tabs, background scripts, a‚Ä¶
articles.title: Modern Browser Extension Development: Supercharge Your Workflow with React, Vue, or Svelte

articles.author: jim alfareh
articles.description:
Large-language models (LLMs) like GPT take every word you type as a fact.
1 | Why We Supply Shaky ‚ÄúFacts‚Äù
Blind-spot source
Everyday slip-up
Proof it‚Äôs real
We overrate our knowledge
Most people feel sure they can explain a bicycle pump ‚Äî until they try. Over 40 % drew bikes that wouldn‚Äôt work. scotthyoung.com
Shared false memories
Millions ‚Äúremember‚Äù Nelson Mandela dying in prison (he didn‚Äôt). Forbes
Self-promotion drift
70 % of job-seekers admit they have lied ‚Äî or would lie ‚Äî on a r√©sum√©. ResumeLab
These slips are harmless in conversation. Inside a chatbot, they harden into ‚Äútruth‚Äù that shapes the entire reply.
2 | Hallucination vs. Blind Spot
Word
What happens
Who starts it?
Hallucination
The model invents facts that are nowhere in the prompt. Example: GPT-4 made up 28.6 % of medical c‚Ä¶
articles.title: Chatbots Believe What You Tell Them ‚Äî Even When You‚Äôre Not Certain

articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
When working with Kotlin in a cloud environment, especially while integrating AWS S3 and Lambda functions, you may find yourself needing to execute an external JAR file. This often arises, as in your case, when you need to upload data to a third-party vendor. In this article, we will walk through how to call an executable JAR file using Kotlin, including syntax examples and considerations to keep in mind.
Understanding How to Execute JAR Files in Kotlin
The process of executing a JAR file in Kotlin is not much different from Java, as Kotlin is fully interoperable with Java. You can use the ProcessBuilder class, which allows you to create operating system processes, and invoke JAR files with specific arguments. This capability is particularly useful when you want to run external commands or‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Execute a JAR File in Kotlin: A Step-by-Step Guide

articles.author: Tim Green
articles.description:
Not long ago, artificial intelligence remained hidden behind elite institutions and guarded corporate doors‚Äîa secretive world inaccessible to most. Today, these once impervious gates swing wide open, propelled by an unstoppable wave: the power of open-source. A movement founded on global collaboration, democratisation of knowledge, and transparent innovation now stands poised to revolutionise our technological future.
Yet how exactly did AI escape the confines of exclusive circles, transforming itself into a shared resource sparking worldwide ingenuity?
To uncover this transformation, let's journey through the vibrant hubs and dynamic communities redefining what's possible when ideas flow freely, unbound by silos or institutional limitations.
In the past, breakthrough advances took years t‚Ä¶
articles.title: AI Unleashed

articles.author: Market Daily
articles.description:
The childfree demographic, consisting of individuals or couples who choose not to have children, is increasingly shaping trends in the real estate market. As this demographic grows, their preferences for housing are influencing various aspects of the housing market, including demand for specific property types, locations, and community features. With different lifestyle priorities, including mobility, urban living, and less space, the childfree population has started to play a more significant role in how developers, investors, and real estate agents approach their offerings.
While the childfree group may share some housing preferences with other demographics, their choices reflect a unique set of needs that is gradually gaining attention from the real estate industry. From the size and lo‚Ä¶
articles.title: How the Childfree Demographic Is Impacting the Real Estate Market

articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
Introduction
Are you currently tackling a pathfinding visualizer app using Dart and Flutter? If you're feeling overwhelmed by the programming challenges and specifically by your container colorization logic, you're not alone! In this article, we will go through how to successfully manage color changes for your start and end containers without affecting all elements on the grid.
Understanding the Problem
In your Flutter application, the objective is to select a 'start' and 'end' container when clicking on the grid, and change their colors accordingly. However, when you try to set the 'start' container color to green, it‚Äôs inadvertently updating every container to green, which is not the intended behavior. This issue typically occurs due to how the state and rendering logic is structured in ‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Fix Colorization Issues in Dart's Pathfinding App?

The newly launched DOOD token from Ethereum-based NFT project Doodles has seen a steep drop in market capitalization following its May 9 airdrop on the Solana network.

DOOD token performance on May 9. Source: DexScreener
Related: Doodles NFT sales surge 97% ahead of DOOD token airdrop
Falling NFT values 
Joining the trend, NFTs in Doodle‚Äôs flagship collection sharply dropped in value on May 9.
The collectibles are down roughly 60% to less than 1.5 Ether (ETH) per NFT from about 3.5 ETH on May 8, according to OpenSea.¬†As of May‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Key Takeaways:

Solana's 15% surge and potential close above the 50-week EMA signal strong bullish momentum, which previously led to a 515% rally in 2024. 

The $120 million in liquidity bridged to Solana reflects growing network confidence.

Solana (SOL) price gained 18% this week, signaling rising bullish momentum. The altcoin is approaching a pivotal point, with a potential close above the 50-week exponential moving average (EMA), a level that has historically catalyzed significant rallies. 
In March, SOL dipped below the 50-week EMA and briefly dropped under $100 on April 7. Since then, Solana has staged a strong recovery, reclaiming key EMA levels (100W and 200W), with the 50-week EMA (blue line) now in focus. 
Solana 1-week chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
Historical patterns‚Ä¶
articles.title: Solana price gained 500% the last time this SOL metric turned bullish

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Cointelegraph
articles.description:
Today in crypto, Galaxy Digital gets US approval to redomicile ahead of a planned Nasdaq listing. German authorities seize $38M in assets tied to the Bybit hack and SEC Commissioner Crenshaw criticizes the agency‚Äôs Ripple settlement.
Galaxy Digital approved for US domicile, clearing way for Nasdaq listing
Galaxy Digital has been approved by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to redomicile in the United States, setting the stage for the crypto investment company‚Äôs listing on the Nasdaq stock exchange.
Galaxy anticipates listing on the Nasdaq, a tech-focused US stock exchange, by the middle of May, pending approval from the Toronto Stock Exchange, on which the company is already listed, and shareholder approval at a special shareholders meeting on May 9.
Galaxy Digital SEC form ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Wall Street giant BlackRock met with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Crypto Task Force to discuss staking within crypto exchange-traded products (ETPs) and tokenization of securities. The discussion could advance institutional interest in the crypto industry.
According to a May 9 memo published by the task force, BlackRock sought to ‚Äú[d]iscuss perspectives on treatment of staking, including considerations for facilitating ETPs with staking capabilities.‚Äù The company has previously said that Ether (ETH) exchange-traded funds, while successful, are less perfect without staking.
Other crypto ETF issuers share that view. On Feb. 15, the New York Stock Exchange proposed a rule change to introduce staking services for Grayscale‚Äôs spot Ether ETFs. In April, the SEC delayed a decision‚Ä¶
articles.title: BlackRock, crypto task force discuss ETP staking, tokenization

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
US Vice President JD Vance will speak at the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas, roughly a year after then-presidential candidate Donald Trump spoke at the same event.
According to a May 9 notice from the event‚Äôs organizers, Vance will address conference attendees in person on May 28, making him the first sitting US vice president to speak at a digital asset conference. 
Trump provided a pre-recorded video of himself from the White House to the organizers of the Digital Asset Summit in March ‚Äî his first appearance at a crypto event since taking office in January ‚Äî and spoke in person at the Bitcoin 2024 conference in Nashville while campaigning.
Though Vance is a Bitcoin (BTC) holder ‚Äî he holds $250,000 to $500,001 worth of the cryptocurrency, according to a financial disclosure filed in‚Ä¶
articles.title: US VP Vance to speak at Bitcoin conference amid Trump crypto controversies

Bitcoin holding $100,000 as a level of support would confirm the current trend change.

Ether leads among altcoins, and DeFi tokens could follow.

Bitcoin (BTC) broke above the psychologically critical $100,000 level on May 8, and the bulls are trying to hold on to the level on May 9. In an X post, CoinGlass said that Bitcoin‚Äôs rally resulted in $837.80 million in short liquidations in a 24-hour period, the largest since 2021.
Bitcoin‚Äôs rally also lifted several major altcoins, which soared above their respective overhead resistance levels. The altcoin rally was led by Ether¬†(ETH), which surged roughly 22% on May 8, triggering a $328 million liquidation of Ether short positions.
Crypto market data daily view. Source: Coin360
Although the short-term picture has turned positive,‚Ä¶
articles.title: Price predictions 5/9: BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, SOL, DOGE, ADA, SUI, LINK, AVAX

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Mining firm TeraWulf reported a net loss of approximately $61.4 million in its earnings for the first quarter of 2025, further deteriorating from the same period last year.
Revenue fell to $34.4 million from $42.4 million in the same period of 2024, according to the company's earnings report, published May 9. Cost of revenue rose sharply to $24.5 million, up from $14.4 million a year earlier.
As a result, TeraWulf's cost of revenue accounted for 71.4% of total income from operations in Q1 2025, more than double the 34% recorded in the prior-year quarter. In Q1 2024, the company posted a net loss of $9.6 million.
TeraWulf‚Äôs profit and loss statement for Q1 2025. Source: TeraWulf
TeraWulf attributed the decreased revenue to Bitcoin's (BTC) post-halving economics that reduced the block subsid‚Ä¶
articles.title: TeraWulf Q1 loss widens amid rising costs, falling revenue

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Ethereum‚Äôs Pectra upgrade doesn‚Äôt pose a threat to decentralization, according to Mallesh Pai, senior research director at blockchain software firm Consensys, describing the update as a cleanup of the behind-the-scenes ‚Äúbusy work‚Äù currently handled by validators. 
During a May 9 Cointelegraph X Space, Pai said a validator‚Äôs chances of proposing a block or earning rewards remain tied to how much ETH they hold, adding that larger validators don‚Äôt gain any new advantages under the upgrade: 
‚ÄúRewards continue to be proportional to the amount of ETH you have. [‚Ä¶] it's not the case that if you're a big validator, you somehow have any more advantages than you did before.‚Äù
Pectra is Ethereum‚Äôs most extensive network upgrade since the Merge took place in September 2022. Pectra allows validators to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethereum's new staking limit is not a risk to decentralization, says Consensys researcher

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
A group of Democratic senators has reportedly sent a letter to leadership at the US Department of Justice and the Treasury Department expressing concerns about US President Donald Trump‚Äôs ties to cryptocurrency exchange Binance and potential conflicts of interest in regulating the industry. 
According to a May 9 Bloomberg report, Democratic senators asked Attorney General Pam Bondi and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent to report on the steps Binance had taken as part of its November 2023 plea agreement with US authorities, amid reports that Trump and his family had deepened connections with the exchange. 
That settlement saw Binance pay more than $4 billion as part of a deal with the Justice Department, Treasury, and Commodity Futures Trading Commission, and had then-CEO Changpeng ‚ÄúCZ‚Äù Zhao‚Ä¶
articles.title: US senators ask DOJ, Treasury to consider Binance-Trump ties ‚Äî Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
Law enforcement detained the wrong person for a 2022 scam that pilfered more than $1 million worth of Bored Ape non-fungible tokens (NFTs), cybersecurity researcher ZachXBT said.¬†
In a May 9 X post, ZachXBT said he identified the wallet behind the scam and linked it to an X account that has since been deleted.¬†
But in 2023, law enforcement detained Sam Curry, a former Yuga Labs security researcher, at an airport as a suspect in the incident, ZachXBT said. Yuga Labs is the company behind the Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT collection.¬†
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs unfortunate to see how a security researcher was detained when stronger leads on a threat actor potentially responsible exist,‚Äù ZachXBT said.
The attacker stole 14 Bored Ape NFTs in 2022. Source: ZachXBT
Related: Crypto sleuth ZachXBT says he unmasked 50x Hype‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto sleuth ZachXBT says wrong suspect detained in Bored Ape NFT theft

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Marie Poteriaieva
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin‚Äôs price closely tracks global liquidity growth, with liquidity explaining up to 90% of its price movements, according to Raoul Pal.

In the long term, global liquidity continues to expand, driven by the increasing debt levels in many countries.

On a shorter timeframe, global liquidity follows a cyclical pattern, with Michael Howell projecting the current cycle to peak by mid-2026.

Bitcoin (BTC) price is notoriously sensitive to global liquidity. Some analysts go as far as calling their correlation near-perfect, with a lag of about three months. This relationship is fueling the current bullish narrative as BTC price soars back above $100,000, but how long can this trend last?
Liquidity is Bitcoin's silent price driver
Raoul Pal, the founder of Global Macro Investor‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin price rallies as global liquidity growth accelerates ‚Äî Analysts

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
The cryptocurrency market continued to surge this past week as the overall digital asset market capitalization exceeded $3.27 trillion, an 8.6% increase over the previous week.
Bitcoin (BTC) reached a high of $103,600 on May 8 after reclaiming $100,000 for the first time since January. Its market dominance also surged above 60%, reflecting more bullish BTC sentiment. This marked the third time BTC has broken through six figures since it reached the milestone on Dec. 5, 2024, and again on Jan. 20, ahead of US President Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration.¬†
The BTC rise coincided with Trump announcing a trade deal with the United Kingdom, which may include removing a 10% blanket tariff on all imports.
In the wider crypto space, Ethereum‚Äôs Pectra upgrade implemented much-needed improvements for the c‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin hits $103K but DeFi is a mixed bag: Finance Redefined

articles.description:
Galaxy Digital has been approved by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to redomicile in the United States, setting the stage for the crypto investment company‚Äôs listing on the Nasdaq stock exchange.
Galaxy¬†anticipates listing on the Nasdaq, a tech-focused US stock exchange, by the middle of May, pending approval from the Toronto Stock Exchange, on which the company is already listed, and shareholder approval at a special shareholders meeting on May 9.
Shareholders at the meeting must approve redomiciling Galaxy Digital in the US state of Delaware, known for its business-friendly regulations, before the process can move forward, according to an announcement from the company.
Galaxy Digital SEC form S-4. Source: SEC
Galaxy obtained SEC approval for a Nasdaq listing in April this‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Biraajmaan Tamuly
articles.description:
Key Takeaways:

Bitcoin is driven by its ability to perform well in risk-on and risk-off environments, according to Bitcoin Suisse. 

Bitcoin‚Äôs Sharpe ratio of 1.72, second only to gold, underscores its maturity as an asset, offering superior risk-adjusted returns.

A buyer-dominant market signals strong institutional and retail interest that could drive a supply squeeze and break new highs in May. 

Bitcoin (BTC) price breached the $100,000 mark for the first time since January, fueling speculation of a new all-time high above $110,000 in May. According to Bitcoin Suisse, a crypto custody service provider, BTC‚Äôs bullish momentum stems from its ability to thrive in risk-on and risk-off environments since the US presidential election.¬†
Data from its ‚ÄúIndustry Rollup‚Äù report highlights Bitco‚Ä¶
articles.title: Chance of Bitcoin price highs above $110K in May increasing ‚Äî Here‚Äôs why

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Naman Kabra
articles.description:
Opinion by: Naman Kabra, co-founder and CEO of NodeOps Network
Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) have become the default hardware for many AI workloads, especially when training large models. That thinking is everywhere. While it makes sense in some contexts, it's also created a blind spot that's holding us back.
GPUs have earned their reputation. They're incredible at crunching massive numbers in parallel, which makes them perfect for training large language models or running high-speed AI inference. That's why companies like OpenAI, Google, and Meta spend a lot of money building GPU clusters.
While GPUs may be preferred for running AI, we cannot forget about Central Processing Units (CPUs), which are still very capable. Forgetting this could be costing us time, money, and opportunity.
CPU‚Ä¶
articles.title: AI's GPU obsession blinds us to a cheaper, smarter solution

articles.author: Cointelegraph by William Suberg
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin continues to attack a key resistance zone below all-time highs.

‚ÄúParabolic‚Äù BTC price talk begins to resurface as bulls hold six figures after the Wall Street open.

Signs of profit-taking are increasing amid the highest prices since January.

Bitcoin (BTC) is attracting ‚Äúparabolic‚Äù price targets as bulls continue to hold six figures on May 9.
BTC/USD 1-hour chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
BTC price in line for ‚Äúcrazy numbers‚Äù

The pair hit $104,332 on Bitstamp, marking its highest since the end of January and a clear departure from the slow downtrend in place for much of 2025.
Reacting, market participants have begun to restore th‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Bitcoin crossed the $100,000 mark again on May 8 as institutional investors continue stacking sats.
Farside Investors‚Äô data shows that spot Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded funds (ETFs) recorded cumulative net inflows of $142.3 million on May 7, in a sign of ‚Äúsustained institutional interest,‚Äù according to the founder of Obchakevich Research, Alex Obchakevich.
‚ÄúThese inflows indicate the activity of institutional investors, including hedge funds and asset managers, who continue to accumulate BTC through regulated instruments,‚Äú he said.
The ARK 21Shares Bitcoin ETF (ARKB) led with $54 million in inflows, followed by Fidelity‚Äôs Wise Origin Bitcoin Fund (FBTC) at $39 million and BlackRock‚Äôs iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) at $37 million. Data from Arkham Intelligence shows BlackRock acquired more t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Institutional investors continue to scoop up Bitcoin above $100K

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
Ripple‚Äôs $25 million donation to a crypto education fund has reignited conversations about how blockchain projects are building influence through academia‚Äîbut in the latest episode of Byte-Sized Insight, Animoca Brands‚Äô co-founder Yat Siu says that money alone isn‚Äôt enough.¬†
Instead, real-world use cases like student loans backed by DeFi may be crypto‚Äôs most convincing value proposition to date.

DeFi student loans
On April 30th, Pencil Finance, a project supported by Animoca Brands and its education arm Open Campus, announced a $10 million student loan financing initiative aimed at providing cheaper, blockchain-backed loans. Siu believes this type of infrastructure investment goes further than symbolic funding.
‚ÄúWhat our industry needs a lot more is these kinds of positive-sum use cases t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why crypto‚Äôs next breakthrough could start in the classroom ‚Äî Animoca‚Äôs Yat Siu

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
The Ethereum Foundation, the nonprofit that supports development across the Ethereum blockchain, distributed $32.6 million in grants in the first quarter of 2025.¬†
In an allocation update, the organization reported spending on various initiatives through its Ecosystem Support Program (ESP).¬†
Categories included community and educational grants, zero-knowledge and cryptography. Other allocations included execution layers, developer experience and tools, layer-2 networks and overall ecosystem growth and support.¬†

Ethereum Foundation focuses on education and community
Of the 101 grants awarded, 32 went to community and education-focused initiatives. Recipients included educational content creators, conference organizers, bootcamps and hackathons such as ETHPrague and ETHiopia.  
Sixteen proj‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethereum Foundation distributed $32.6M grants to ecosystem in Q1

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
Gemini, the cryptocurrency exchange founded by Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, has received regulatory approval to expand crypto derivatives trading across Europe.
Gemini secured a Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (MiFID II) license from the Malta Financial Services Authority (MFSA), allowing the exchange to offer crypto derivatives in the European Union, it announced on May 9.
‚ÄúOnce we commence business activities, we will be able to offer regulated derivatives throughout the EU and EEA [European Economic Area] under MiFID II,‚Äù said Gemini‚Äôs head of Europe, Mark Jennings.
According to the exec, the MiFID II license is a big milestone in Gemini‚Äôs European expansion, putting it one step closer to offering derivatives to both retail and institutional users.
Advanced traders will g‚Ä¶
articles.title: Gemini to launch crypto derivatives in Europe with new license

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Shailey Singh
articles.description:
What is TapSwap on Telegram?            
            
                
TapSwap is a tap-to-earn Web3 application that lives inside Telegram ‚Äî no separate download required.
Are your crypto friends obsessed with tapping their phones all the time? Welcome to the world of TapSwap. TapSwap is a tap-to-earn game released in mid-2024 in the Telegram Mini Apps ecosystem. The game quickly catches your attention: one minute you‚Äôre just curious‚Ä¶ the next, you‚Äôre tapping away at 2 am trying to squeeze out one more energy boost.¬†
At its core, TapSwap is simple:

You tap your screen.
You earn TAPS tokens.
Repeat.


It‚Äôs built as a Mini App inside Telegram, which means no downloading or setting up complicated wallets just to play. Just hit ‚ÄúStart‚Äù and you‚Äôre in. Launched in early 2024, it quickly amasse‚Ä¶
articles.title: TapSwap on Telegram: Is it legit or a scam?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Senate Banking Committee Chairman Tim Scott blamed the Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins (GENIUS) Act‚Äôs failure on partisan politics during a Senate speech on May 8.
Scott said the vote, which failed to reach cloture in the Senate, was expected to mark a step toward greater affordability and innovation. Instead, he said, political divisions took precedence.  
‚ÄúInstead, we witnessed a disappointing display of political gamesmanship that puts partisan politics above policy, and obstruction above innovation, ‚ÄúScott said.
The bill had previously undergone multiple amendments to address concerns raised by Democrats, including stricter requirements for stablecoin issuers and further provisions for Anti-Money Laundering.
Related: Trump tricked into pushing XRP for cr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Senator Tim Scott slams partisan politics for failed stablecoin bill

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
Taiwanese lawmaker Ko Ju-Chun has called on the government to consider adding Bitcoin to its national reserves, suggesting it could serve as a hedge against global economic uncertainty.  
Ko, a legislator at-large in Taiwan‚Äôs legislative body, the Legislative Yuan, took to X on Friday to report that he had advocated Bitcoin (BTC) investment by the Taiwanese government at the National Conference on May 9.
In his remarks, Ko cited Bitcoin‚Äôs potential to become a hedge amid global economic risks and urged Taiwan to recognize the cryptocurrency alongside gold and foreign exchange reserves to boost its financial resilience.
Source: Ko Ju-Chun
Ko‚Äôs announcement came shortly after the legislator held talks with Samson Mow, who advocates for Bitcoin adoption by states like El Salvador at his BTC t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Taiwan lawmaker calls for Bitcoin reserve at national conference

articles.author: Cointelegraph by William Suberg
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin (BTC) is at its highest levels since January, and traders are eyeing key levels to watch for what‚Äôs next.

After hitting $104,000, BTC/USD is retracing to establish support, but the fate of $100,000 is among the concerns for market participants.

Current price action represents an important battleground, as measured from the $75,000 lows this year.


‚Äù Headline driven‚Äù BTC price gains draw scrutiny
Just $6,000 from new all-time highs, per data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and TradingView, BTC price action has stunned the market by jumping 10% in days.
The pace of the BTC price gains has come as a surprise for many, but longer-term perspectives show where the most difficult battleground lies.
‚ÄúSince this current impulse was primarily headline driven again this puts ma‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin eyes sub-$100K liquidity ‚Äî Watch these BTC price levels next

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Nancy Lubale
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin was up 4.3% on May 9, after breaking $100,000¬† for the first time since February.

BTC price gains trigger $800 million in short liquidations, the largest since 2021.

A bull flag on the weekly chart suggests a $182,200 target, with analysts predicting Bitcoin‚Äôs price can go as high as $1 million in 2025.

Bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) price is up 4.3% on May 9 as a fresh liquidity cascade sent BTC price soaring above $100,000 for the first time in over 90 days.
BTC/USD pair trades above $100K for the first time since Feb. 4. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
Bitcoin wipes out liquidity in return to 6-figures
BTC/USD rose as high as $104,150 during the late New York trading session on May 8, according to data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and Bitstamp. Crypto market sentiment, a‚Ä¶
articles.title: How high can Bitcoin price go?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
German law enforcement seized 34 million euros ($38 million) in cryptocurrency from eXch, a cryptocurrency platform allegedly used to launder funds stolen after Bybit‚Äôs record-breaking $1.4 billion hack.
The seizure, announced on May 9 by Germany‚Äôs Federal Criminal Police Office (BKA) and Frankfurt‚Äôs main prosecutor‚Äôs office, involved multiple crypto assets, including Bitcoin (BTC), Ether (ETH), Litecoin (LTC) and Dash (DASH). The move marks the third-largest crypto confiscation in the BKA‚Äôs history.
The authorities also seized eXch‚Äôs German server infrastructure with over eight terabytes of data and shut down the platform, the announcement added.
eXch exchanged crypto without AML
In the statement, the BKA described eXch as a ‚Äúswapping‚Äù service that allowed users to exchange various crypto‚Ä¶
articles.title: Germany seizes $38M in crypto from Bybit hack-linked eXch exchange

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Bradley Peak
articles.description:
What Pi Network promised            
            
                
When Pi Network first hit the scene in 2019, it had a simple but compelling pitch: What if you could mine cryptocurrency straight from your phone ‚Äî no expensive gear, no massive electricity bills, just a tap a day on an app?
It caught fire. Millions of people jumped on board, lured by the idea of ‚Äúfree‚Äù mobile mining and a chance to get in early on the next big thing. The app made it easy: You signed up, invited a few friends, tapped a button every 24 hours, and watched your Pi (PI) balance slowly grow. With the social referral model fueling growth, it wasn‚Äôt long before over 70 million users had signed up worldwide.

Did you know? Pi Network utilizes the Stellar Consensus Protocol (SCP), which aims for energy efficiency an‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is Pi Network dead? What really went wrong behind the hype

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
Solana has yet to show convincing signs that it could surpass Ethereum as the preferred blockchain for institutions, as its revenue, heavily reliant on memecoins, is considered unstable, according to crypto bank group Sygnum.
In a May 8 blog post, Sygnum said that the current sentiment around Ethereum ‚Äúremains poor,‚Äù with the market focused on Solana‚Äôs ‚Äútransaction volumes and its recent dominance in fee generation.‚Äù
However, Sygnum said ‚Äúthe medium-term outlook will primarily be shaped by traditional financial institutions‚Äô platform choices to bring their product offerings,‚Äù not by sentiment.
‚ÄúWe do not yet see convincing signs that Solana would be the preferred choice as Ethereum‚Äôs security, stability and longevity are highly prized,‚Äù it added.
Sygnum argued that institutions could choos‚Ä¶
articles.title: Solana lacks ‚Äòconvincing signs‚Äô of besting Ethereum: Sygnum

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
American fast food outlet Steak ‚Äòn Shake has announced it will begin accepting Bitcoin as payment at all locations starting on May 16.
The firm said on X on May 9 that it was making the cryptocurrency available to more than 100 million customers, adding that ‚Äúthe movement is just beginning,‚Äù before signing off as ‚ÄúSteaktoshi.‚Äù¬†
The fast food chain initially hinted at accepting Bitcoin (BTC) in March when it posted ‚ÄúShould Steak ‚Äòn Shake accept Bitcoin?‚Äù on social media.¬†
The tweet drew the attention of the crypto community and Bitcoin proponents such as Jack Dorsey, who rapidly replied with a ‚Äúyes.‚Äù¬†
The firm has built momentum since then with Bitcoin-themed marketing, Tesla promotions, and visual hints on its social media feeds.
‚ÄúThe future is bright,‚Äù said the firm in April. Source: Stak‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin accepted at fast food chain Steak ‚Äôn Shake from May 16

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Fresh off its most recent Bitcoin purchase, Japanese investment firm Metaplanet is raising more funds through another bond issue to expand its growing crypto treasury.
Through a $21.25 million issue of ‚Äú0% Ordinary Bonds,‚Äù  all the ‚Äúfunds raised will be allocated to the purchase of Bitcoin,‚Äù the firm said in a May 9 statement. 
Zero-coupon bonds don‚Äôt offer any interest to the holder. Most of the time, they are issued at a steep discount from their normal value, and when they mature, the holder receives the full value.
After its most recent May 9 board of directors meeting, the firm said it will issue a 14th Stock Acquisition Rights to EVO Fund, an investment management firm in the Cayman Islands, with a redemption date of Nov. 7.
Source: Metaplanet
At current prices, Metaplanet could buy ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Metaplanet is raising another $21M through bonds to buy more Bitcoin
